name: GlyphoMax 41 SL
description: Herbicide — Active: Glyphosate 41% SL. Use for post-emergent control of broadleaf weeds and grasses. Formulation: Soluble Liquid.

name: Atrazine Pro 500
description: Herbicide — Active: Atrazine 50% WP. Pre- and post-emergent control of annual broadleaf and grassy weeds in corn. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: ParaSafe 36 EC
description: Herbicide — Active: Paraquat 36% EC. Fast-acting contact herbicide for weed desiccation. Handle with care; restricted use.

name: CyperShield 10 EC
description: Insecticide — Active: Cypermethrin 10% EC. Broad-spectrum control of chewing and sucking insects. Formulation: Emulsifiable Concentrate.

name: Imidacare 20 SC
description: Insecticide — Active: Imidacloprid 20% SC. Systemic insecticide for aphids, whiteflies and other sap-feeders. Formulation: Suspension Concentrate.

name: Chlorothalonil Guard 75 WG
description: Fungicide — Active: Chlorothalonil 75% WG. Protective fungicide for leaf spots and blights. Formulation: Water Dispersible Granule.

name: Mancozeb Plus 80 WP
description: Fungicide — Active: Mancozeb 80% WP. Broad-spectrum control for fungal diseases. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: MycoGuard 20 SC
description: Fungicide — Active: Azoxystrobin 20% SC. Systemic fungicide for rusts and spots. Formulation: Suspension Concentrate.

name: Copper Shield 50 WP
description: Fungicide/Bactericide — Active: Copper oxychloride 50% WP. Protects against fungal and bacterial diseases. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: NeemBio 0.3 EC
description: Bio-insecticide — Active: Azadirachtin 0.3% EC. Organic option for soft-bodied pests and growth disruption. Formulation: Emulsifiable Concentrate.

name: BacGuard WG
description: Bio-fungicide — Active: Bacillus subtilis strain for disease suppression. Use as protectant and inducer of plant defenses. Formulation: Water Dispersible Granule.

name: S-Metolachlor 960 EC
description: Pre-emergent Herbicide — Active: S-metolachlor 960 g/L EC. Controls annual grasses and some broadleaves. Formulation: Emulsifiable Concentrate.

name: Dicamba XT 480 SL
description: Herbicide — Active: Dicamba 48% SL. Broadleaf weed control in tolerant crops; follow label for rotation restrictions.

name: LambdaPro 2.5 CS
description: Insecticide — Active: Lambda-cyhalothrin 2.5% CS. Broad-spectrum knockdown and residual control. Formulation: Capsule Suspension.

name: Spinetor 12 SC
description: Insecticide — Active: Spinetoram 12% SC. Effective against caterpillars and leafminers. Formulation: Suspension Concentrate.

name: Oxathiap 25 WG
description: Insecticide — Active: Oxathiapiprolin 25% WG. Effective against oomycete pathogens (fungal-like). Formulation: Water Dispersible Granule.

name: Metalaxyl-M 35 WP
description: Fungicide — Active: Metalaxyl-M 35% WP. Systemic control of downy mildews and oomycetes. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: Fenbuconazole 25 EC
description: Fungicide — Active: Fenbuconazole 25% EC. Broad-spectrum systemic fungicide for cereals and fruits. Formulation: Emulsifiable Concentrate.

name: Methiocarb 50 WP
description: Insecticide/Slug Pellets — Active: Methiocarb 50% WP. Controls slugs and snails in various crops. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: Pyraclostrobin 33 WG
description: Fungicide — Active: Pyraclostrobin 33% WG. Protectant and curative action for multiple diseases. Formulation: Water Dispersible Granule.

name: Chlorpyrifos 40 EC
description: Insecticide — Active: Chlorpyrifos 40% EC. Broad-spectrum control of soil and foliar pests. Note regulatory restrictions in some regions.

name: Thiabendazole 50 WP
description: Fungicide — Active: Thiabendazole 50% WP. Seed treatment and post-harvest disease control. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: Sulfur 80 WP
description: Fungicide/Acaricide — Active: Sulfur 80% WP. Traditional product for powdery mildew and mites. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: Oxamyl 24 SL
description: Nematicide/Insecticide — Active: Oxamyl 24% SL. Controls nematodes and certain insects; use carefully per label.

name: Sulfoxaflor 150 OD
description: Insecticide — Active: Sulfoxaflor 150 g/L OD. Targeted control for sap-feeding insects; follow pollinator safety guidance.

name: Buprofezin 25 WP
description: Insect Growth Regulator — Active: Buprofezin 25% WP. Controls scale and whitefly nymphs. Formulation: Wettable Powder.

name: Strobilurins Combo 40 WG
description: Fungicide Mix — Contains Azoxystrobin + Difenoconazole. Broad-spectrum disease control in fruits and vegetables. Formulation: WG.

name: Sodium Bicarbonate 45 WP
description: Fungicide (biorational) — Sodium bicarbonate based foliar spray for mild disease suppression. Safe for organic use in some programs.

name: Permethrin 25 EC
description: Insecticide — Active: Permethrin 25% EC. Fast-acting contact insecticide for diverse pests. Formulation: Emulsifiable Concentrate.

name: Azoxystrobin 10 SC
description: Fungicide — Active: Azoxystrobin 10% SC. Systemic protectant for many foliar diseases. Formulation: Suspension Concentrate.

name: Deltamethrin 2.5 EC
description: Insecticide — Active: Deltamethrin 2.5% EC. Broad-spectrum control with strong knockdown. Formulation: Emulsifiable Concentrate.

name: Mancozeb + Metalaxyl 72 WP
description: Fungicide Mix — Mancozeb + Metalaxyl for durable control of multiple diseases. Formulation: WP.

name: Fludioxonil 25 SC
description: Fungicide — Active: Fludioxonil 25% SC. Post-harvest and seed treatment fungicide. Formulation: SC.

name: Copper Soap 15 EC
description: Fungicide/Bactericide — Copper soap formulation for fruit tree sprays; reduced phytotoxicity risk.

name: Rotenone 5 EC
description: Bio-insecticide — Traditional botanical insecticide for small-scale organic-compatible use; check local regulations.

name: Pyriproxyfen 10 WP
description: Insect Growth Regulator — Active: Pyriproxyfen 10% WP. Disrupts insect development (eggs/larvae).

name: Carbendazim 50 WP
description: Fungicide — Active: Carbendazim 50% WP. Systemic fungicide for seed and foliar disease control.

name: Quinclorac 75 WG
description: Herbicide — Active: Quinclorac 75% WG. Selective control of grassy and certain broadleaf weeds in rice and turf.

name: Iprodione 50 WP
description: Fungicide — Active: Iprodione 50% WP. Control of botrytis and sclerotinia in vegetables and ornamentals.

name: Bentazon 480 SL
description: Herbicide — Active: Bentazon 48% SL. Post-emergent control of broadleaf weeds in certain crops.

name: Mepiquat Chloride 12 SL
description: Plant Growth Regulator — Active: Mepiquat chloride 12% SL. Used to reduce vegetative growth and improve fruiting.

name: Kaolin Clay 95 WP
description: Particle Film — Kaolin-based spray to deter pests and reduce sunburn on fruit; compatible with IPM.

name: Hydrogen Peroxide 27.5% EC
description: Sanitizer/Fungicide — Use for foliar disinfecting and post-harvest washing per label.

name: Silicon Solution 10 SL
description: Crop Strengthener — Soluble silicon for improved plant resistance to abiotic and biotic stressors.

name: Sulfoxide Adjuvant 90 ML
description: Spray adjuvant — Improves spread, penetration and rainfastness of foliar sprays.

name: Surfactant Blend 100 ML
description: Non-ionic surfactant to improve wetting and uptake of pesticides and fertilizers.

name: Neem Oil 30 EC
description: Botanical insecticide and fungicide — Cold-pressed neem oil formulation for organic use.

name: Fermentation Extract 25 SC
description: Bio-fertilizer/Biostimulant — Extracts to promote soil and plant microbial health.

name: Clothianidin 50 WG
description: Insecticide — Active: Clothianidin 50% WG. Systemic neonicotinoid for soil/seed treatments; follow pollinator safety instructions.

name: Integrated Pack (Starter)
description: Starter bundle — Small farmer kit with low-toxicity herbicide, bio-insecticide, surfactant and instructions for IPM use.
